website_summaries.verdict: While it isn't infallible, the Western Digital WD TV HD Media Player plays back a wide array of audio, video, and image files on your TV without the need for a computer.
pros: Compact adapter allows for playback of USB-based multimedia files on TV
reads a lot of file formats
both HDMI and composite video connections
able to connect up to two mass USB storage devices at one time via side- and rear-mounted USB ports
cons: Couldn't play back audio on some files
eSATA, FireWire, or flash media reader options would've been nice as well

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good - but requires patience.
customer_reviews.text: Accomplishes all of the huge number of functions described pretty well. Pros: Lots of capability in a little inexpensive box. Much smaller than a MyBook. Excellent Quality via HDMI to an HDTV - full 1920x1080p. Great way to put your pictures on a big flat panel TV. USB port powers portable 2.5" hard drives. Cons: Several minutes to scan 20GB on a hard drive. Something like 5sec. to change 5Mpixel images - you need to re-size pix to fit the screen. Doesn't promise to and doesn't work with my USB flash drives. Powers the HDMI port when unit is 'off', disabling the auto select function of my HDMI switch.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: HDTV from a hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This little device is wonderful. I've been using it for a couple of months to watch downloaded videos and movies. Today I did a firmware update (available from the Western Digital website) on it and when re-connecting the hard drive to the old adapter, I thought about using a Thermaltake BlacX ST0005U docking station to hold the hard drive instead the mess of wires and adapter I was using. The docking station works just great, takes up little space, holds any size SATA drive and connects to the Western Digital WD TV HD Media Player using a USB cable. I have just enjoyed almost four hours of very high quality HDTV movies.
customer_reviews.author: Harlow House

customer_reviews.title: Great product for video
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent. It reads all the known video formats for DVD's. It can also read ISO files. I didn't use it at all to listen to music or to view pictures so I can't comment on these functions it also has. The only flaw is that in HD files (MKV) it doesn't read the DTS sound encoding, so you can see the video but without sound. I hope WD will fix this flaw soon and this will be the perfect media player. In general I am very happy with the device. The 5th start will be given after the firmware upgrade that will allow it to read DTS sound from MKV files.
customer_reviews.author: Eran Shpigelman

customer_reviews.title: Best media player for the money...
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased two units for my friends and relatives abroad. A week later my boss and I decided to buy two units to try. At first, it didn't play audio on some of my DVD ripped files until I learned that I have to download a firmware to fix related and other problems that I haven't experienced yet. After updating the player, everything worked fine and even my AVI files played beautifully with my overhead projector on a 120" screen. The upscaling of the video to HD is excellent. Definitely, I will recommend this unit to all my friends. I just wished I can jump from one chapter to another on a dvd file.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Raymundo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device! LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this only a few days but I can tell you it is incredible. Imagine have all of your photos (in my case this is about 6 GB worth) and all of your DVDs available for viewing just as you would watch a DVD....but you can see it all without getting up and changing anything! I have at the moment about 35 disc images for movies and all my pictures on a WD Passport 360GB drive (storage is purchased separately) and the WD Media Player handles them all with ease. The menu is laid out logically and the options are intuitive and simple to invoke. What a fantastic idea!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Krause

customer_reviews.title: Great price but not to be used with large collections
customer_reviews.text: It delivers what it promises, simple, easy to use and great price. Great for movies. Not good if you need to "find" something. Usability is good ONLY if your collection is small, or just a pen-drive. Not good at all for lots of music or pictures. There is no search feature, so looking for your favorite music artist can be a drag if you have a midsize to large collection. It only allows you to "list" them. Meaning that in order to get to the artists starting with G, you need to browse all you have before that. Same applies to other filters such us Genre or Album.
customer_reviews.author: Gaston Draque

customer_reviews.title: Perfect media center for my tv hobby.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item after extensive and exhausting search for media center system. Iwas about to buy new computer and set it up for this purpose when I stumble upon this little cute box at BestBuy. It is send from God by angels. It does everything what I need and even more. Not to much space, easy to use and very cool looking. I already put half of my DVD collection on it. I use DVDShrink to save space and all files play perfect. Price is very economical. Only drawback is remote and not able to play DVD menu's( so far). Thanks Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The WD HD Media Player is the most satisfying gadget I have purchased this year. I teamed it with a 500GB WD Passport which is USB powered and it plays everything I throw at it without a hitch. One of the main reasons I purchased it was for mkv playability and it works excellent. Now I dont't have to convert my video files and burn them to a DVD so I can watch them on my TV. The only thing that could really improve on this device is the addition of an ethernet port. But thats just being picky. Sneekernet works just fine. For what it does and for what it cost...You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement For TV
customer_reviews.text: We cancelled cable TV earlier this year. I was sick of the prices and we only watch a handfull of shows. So, I use this WD TV thingy coupled with a laptop to stream new shows off Hulu/Joost. I've got a bunch of DVD's ripped to a USB drive that I hook up to the WD TV (Simpsons, Scrubs, Arrested Development, etc...). This thing works great. My only complaint is the lack of volume control. Not a big deal as we can controll it through the receiver. Just would've been a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: Do the new ones control a hard drive - or just online content?
customer_reviews.text: I use this for online content - AND - to watch movies from a hard disk drive. Finding units that will control a hard drive in addition to online content is becoming more and more difficult to find. Wish all would control a hard drive. Keep hard drive control on these boxes!! It's such an easy addition!!
customer_reviews.author: Babbo

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: Only negative I have found is the way in which you must search for your files. If you have a lot of files on a hard drive hooked up to this unit, it is difficult finding a particular file. If all were displayed at once there would be no problem but you must click through many tabs before finding your file. Over all its worth the price since I no longer need to burn all my media onto disks to hear or view them now which saves a bundle of money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Toney

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: i really like this thing; took a minute; at first, could not get hdmi output to 'keep'...and every now and then i have to unplug the hdmi cable to reconnect it. otherwise, works great; simple menus, great image. my only gripe, external drive does not unmount when i shut off the player, but i can live with that. and happy to see the subtitles work! a great investment, and a way for me to watch my movie library on a new tv. recommended!
customer_reviews.author: fff3k

customer_reviews.title: Movie Nights are here!!
customer_reviews.text: This device works perfectly for the movie lover who wants to backup all of their DVD, HD-DVD, Blu-Ray titles while having the ability to play them from their own HD TV or SD TV. The product setup is very simple, just plug in a usb external drive filled with movies and then plug the WDTV into your television with either HDMI or S-Video/RCA cables. I have not had any issues that have been previously reported regarding the remote control, or horrible playback issues. Great product for the price and functions.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Why change discs when you can put it all in one place?
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my home. The original and the 2nd version. Both are good machines and a great way to watch all your movies without dealing with discs. My only complaints, the older version has to be power cycled if it sits for a day or two unused and the newer one won't accept older hard drives. So far both have played every format I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: David Taylor

customer_reviews.title: ok but not quite there
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based off of other reviews I had seen on it, but when I played an HD video file it was really choppy and suffered when the image was dark, also noticed the image wasn't quite full HD resolution, even when using the HDMI port. Compared the same HD video file on this and my PS3 and the PS3 was far more superior in image quality,infact video's looked better running 720p on my ps3 than it did running 1080 anything on here, also it runs really really hot, hope I didn't get a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: The WD TV HD media player works as advertised. It played all the video, music and photos I tried and worked with all my pen drives and USB hard disks. It does a good work of scaling the images and videos to fit the TV resolution. It works with both standard and HD TV. The only complaint is that the progress bar, which shows when you start or pause the video partially obscures the subtitles. also, you won't have as much control as you have with mplayer on a PC (i.e. skip x seconds, change subtitle position or size, etc.). on the other hand is much more comfortable watching videos on a TV than on a PC.
customer_reviews.author: gizmopepper707

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1TB drive almost full of mp3 music. When I turned it on it would take 20 minutes to load up to the WDTV Player. I sent it back and connected an old desktop PC to play movies through an HDMI card as well as music. This unit seemed very temperamental when it booted up and I did a search for movies or tv shows
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital WD TV HD Media Player
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of making DVD's, then this is the trick. I have not recorded a DVD since this little box arrived. It does play .MKV files just fine...but I do seem to have a little difficulty with 1080p audio and must step them down to 720p to get the audio to work correctly...no real loss as the picture is just a good anyway to the average viewer. A must have if you have large .MKV files you wish to watch and are unable to record to a DVD.
customer_reviews.author: Guy E. Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product to quickly view the images and videos on TV. Works fine with Hard drive that has Windows format but not with Mac - had to buy another Hard drive exclusively for this. Also the sound quality was not great. While the videos sound good on my PC, they sound too loud and with lot of noise. Not sure if hard disk's problem or player's problem. Overall good product - well imagined.
customer_reviews.author: RGPN

customer_reviews.title: Great Invention!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Western Digital Media player for my son for Christmas. I cannot tell you how much we enjoyed it while he was here. It actually prompted us to purchase our own. My son is a real movie buff and was thrilled with the movies and tv shows he could watch. We got a kick out of seeing our photos on a 46 in. screen! The price was right and when we purchased the player we were able to get the hdmi cables for $.19! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Miklowcic

customer_reviews.title: Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Positives: 1. The unit operates the way the description says it does. 2. I like the resume feature: When you stop a video it will resume from where it left off, and I believe even if you go into another video it will remember where it was. Negatives: 1. The unit itself gets quite warm, warmer than I would like and so I pull the power plug after each use. Even when not in use, the unit stays warm. 2. The navigation is not great. 3. The remote is occasionally a little unresponsive, and you cannot access anything in your hard drive with out it. Conclusion: Not a bad purchase for the price. It works.
customer_reviews.author: P. Thornley

customer_reviews.title: Great and simple media player
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. Very simple to install and use, and with the ability to upgrade its software very easily too. I couldn't make the .srt subtitles work. But hopefully this could be solve via software upgrade any time in the future (near future would be nice). Also the interface is a little dull. Can be solved via future upgrades though. Overall, a great media player.
customer_reviews.author: Wawa

customer_reviews.title: i like it very much
customer_reviews.text: I connected my 1TB western digital hard disk to it and it can play a variety of video formats (including H.264 Blue ray DVD rips). Watching Lost series and Planet earth Blue ray DVD rips and the quality of the videos are too good on a 47 inch LCD TV. No problems so far (2 months).... Some times you may need to reset it to factory defaults to make it work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sriram Sridhar

customer_reviews.title: awesome little box
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this little video player. For awhile I've been trying to figure out the best way to stream videos to my big screen tv and this video player does everything I want. Plays mkv, avi, dvd iso and a few others. The only disappontment is that is does not recognize ext3 partitions which didn't really surprise me. Tested it with a small USB drive formatted as FAT32 and it worked flawlessly. Reformatted the drive to NTFS and again, no problems. Eventually went out and bought a WD USB hard drive to go with it although any USB drive should work.
customer_reviews.author: Bmw

customer_reviews.title: FF/REW Issues
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I got it a year ago. But I've run into a problem I haven't found a way around yet. Shows record fine, but if when watching the show, I try to Fast Forward or Rewind, it jumps incomprehensibly. So if you can watch a show without FF or REW, this is the thing for you; if not, beware. I was using MP4's.....
customer_reviews.author: DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for displaying digital images
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the media player to cycle through images of my various vacations on my 70" TV. Western Digital's unit has been perfect for this purpose. It will randomly display the images so I get a different sequence everytime. I've programmed it as a macro on my univeral remote so I can switch to the media player as a "screen saver" at the push of a button. It's a good product and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Great media solution for digital music, movies and pictures
customer_reviews.text: The WD media player is a terrific solution to viewing all your stored media from an external hard drive or thumb drive. WD has great tech support, user forums and continuous updates through firmware. I can't find anything to complain about. I play stored music playlists without a hitch. Two thumbs up from this happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: great media player
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use, and quality of movies played is very crisp and good. liked the versatility in the video format supported. Had an issue in being able support digital audio while using a projector. Used my lap to play HD video to get the audio working. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend this product for versatility, portability and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mekfly

customer_reviews.title: Still working great.
customer_reviews.text: I'm just now getting around to writing a review. This is great and still works like new. There is a lot more you can do with it that you think. Visit some of the WD forums and you'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Nifty gadget!
customer_reviews.text: The WD Media Player works rather slick for me. I've transfered my old home videos to a portable hard drive and can now easily watch them on my HD television. Some media types won't play well (for example, certain .avi files). It plays all my .mpg and .mp3 files, though. Pretty simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the things I love about this product. 1. It is easy to setup and use. 2. It works with almost any external USB hard drives. 3. It reads most video file formats and the video play back is amazing. 4. It is worth the price. 5. The menu interface is smooth, you can organize your folders on your PC then use the remote to navigate on the screen. 6. You can view pictures and even play music too. 7. It makes my DVD library look like my old VHS library.
customer_reviews.author: Dellane

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I had a DLO dock before and what a pain and the menus not very good. Then I saw this little gem and took a chance, I'm glad I did. Very clear picture, great menus that are easy to navigate, two usb ports, easy to use remote, hook up in less than two minutes. I am ordering another for the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bramlett

customer_reviews.title: WD HD Media Player Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to show video clips on my LCD TV taken on my casio camera. Its a very small and convenient media player almost exactly the dimensions of the Netflix Roku player. Plays most formats for video, music, pics etc. Note, it does not show a picture preview of the video files like windows media player does so you need to tittle your video clips. The player is no speed demon when switching between video clips but is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, maybe a little expensive for what is does, but it reads any kind of format. It has support for 2 hard drives. It takes sometime to read the Hard Drive for the first time, and also it doesn't give tou a thumbnail in the case of AVI movies, but it does with photos. It is tricky to make forward to jump in 10 minutes increments. You have to put fast forward at 4x and then click con forward increments to advance the movie by 10 minutes. But other than that, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Torre

customer_reviews.title: Okay - But some UI issues...
customer_reviews.text: Quick review: - Took 20 minutes to recognize my external (WD 1Tb), I'm guessing because it was big. So whenever I unplug it to update media files, it takes an additional 20 minutes to load... kind of silly. *note: loads 16gb USB fast... - No power button on console, only on remote (which is small and hides frequently). - Cannot play some of the audio codecs for some files (I don't remember which ones off the top of my head). Plays all my movies well, but some TV episodes lack audio. - On the plus side, the menu organization is intuitive and nice. overall = meh.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The WDTV is a great little device. I have used it in my home and car with the LCD screens and it works perfectly. The only thing I wish is that it turned off the mini WD HD that I use with it. The HD stays on when I power down the device. I have played all types of media on it form Xvid, Divix, AVI, MKV, and high def 264H AAC. It all played perfectly. Very hapy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Bresummit

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and expasible functionality
customer_reviews.text: the device is amazing, small and powerful, bang for a buck as it supports the most popular audio/video formats available out there today and for those of you who have the time/skills/guts... you can flash the firmware (pretty easy and painlessly b.t.w) to add USB to Ethernet support for network streaming, web server GUI, torrent server and others through custom (unsupported firmware of course, wouldn't know about your warranty, but works like a charm ;) ) from [...]
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas E. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: it's like a magic box
customer_reviews.text: I love this Western Digital WD TV Media Player. I received it quickly and in new condition. I set it up using the directions, much easier than I thought it would be. I can dowload things on my computer, copy them on a flashdrive and watch them on my big TV. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Box
customer_reviews.text: This little fantastic box does all it advertises, plays high number of formats and displays a superb quality. only thing i noticed, it really gets warm (hot?) even turned off! so recommend you unplug the device when not in use
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Good Media Player
customer_reviews.text: This neat little units does just what it says it will do. This is a no frills media player to view your digital library on television. It does not have the sophistication of menus or features we expect in a dvd player or vcr and it is easy to imagine the next generations will see improvements but for now this will do the trick. It is small enough to pack for travel and I am enjoying using it.. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: W. Parris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: It plays most of my mkv files flawlessly! Unfortunately, it still has a couple of problems with some mkvs, most especially wmv files. I was about to give it 5 stars! Until I came across some glitches. I do hope that future firmware upgrades will solve these little problems! :) Overall, I'm still very happy with my purchase! Got my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Barreiro

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and "portable" entertainment for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: We bring this to work to keep our kids entertained as well as on vacations. We hook it up to any of our flash drives which will have some sort of cartoon or movie for them to watch. Plug and play...it's really amazing--wish I would have had it earlier!
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: I love my WDTV (Western Digital Television)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, I have pretty much quit using cable since I recieved this gem. Works better than the suite of video players I have ony my PC. Plays better than Divx/Vlc/Mediaplayer, etc. Interface takes some time to get used to (Don't they all). The remote is a little tiny thing, and can be blocked off easily if thier is IR bleed so if your unit doesn't pick up signal well, just move it around. In a rank of my best electronic purchases it goes like this. 1) Computer 2) Widescreen 42" 3) WDTV Get it. Get it now.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great device.
customer_reviews.text: This product performs extremely well, allows playing all types of media files on the TV or HDTV. You should update the firmware available from Western Digital website for improvements. It's extremely simple. WDTV supports subtitles and that's awesome. I use subtitles in .srt format and I have no problems with that. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Leon

customer_reviews.title: great price even better sound
customer_reviews.text: This maked DVD's obsolete. Great to be able to watch a movie without having to change DVD's . Also, no more DVD storage problems. I have over 400 movied on a 1TB portable drive and I have room for about 500 more. All in a 3"x5"x1/2" box :))
customer_reviews.author: Albert Noel Miller

customer_reviews.title: Eats every media file I have
customer_reviews.text: Great media player. Good interface. Likes my homemade DIVX and every other format I have. No internal storage. cons: No Ethernet, no volume control If this could read off of my NAS via wireless it would be just about perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Torgo-San

customer_reviews.title: WD TV REMOTE
customer_reviews.text: This reasonably priced replacement worked right out of the box, did not even need the instructions. The WD TV box is useless with a remote, so I was pleased as punch to find one. The shipping was reasonable and very speedy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Melton

customer_reviews.title: Great little toy
customer_reviews.text: I have both the WDTV and the Mvix 780HD and since I purchased the WDTV, I pretty much abandoned the Mvix because of HD support on WDTV and because the Mvix is so unstable, slow. The only shortcoming with the WDTV is DTS audio support (HDMI 1.3?) Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I use this almost everyday
customer_reviews.text: It play pretty mush every video format, and is easy to use and put together. This is one of the best things I ever bought on Amazon you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great Device  for HD Media Player
customer_reviews.text: This device works great, I haved played lots of AVI files downloaded from internet, even High definition works great (mkv files). Don't used USB hard drive with power adapter, only used USB Hard Drive powered by the USB port from the Desktop or Laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Guzman

customer_reviews.title: QUICK AND EASY
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly and once the cables were hooked up it took only 3 to 4 minutes to scan my 320Gb drive. I haven't had a movie format that it has not payed. Well worth the investment and is making burning DVD's a thing of the past for me.
customer_reviews.author: PDCRUISER

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. As others have stated, you must have a dts converter to hear ac3 audio. I have not been able to fix this issue yet but others have. I do wish WD could have given the dts compatable firmware update for the wd first generation, but to no avail. I would still recommend this 10000 times, I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Robert Diermayer

customer_reviews.title: WD TV HD
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for to play my digital files on my TV. It does not play divx but what you do is just rename the file .divx to .avi. on your computer. After that the WD TV plays the movie. I am very pleased with this product. I especially love the remote. It makes watching all my media very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vega

customer_reviews.title: This Product is the Best!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product plugged in and worked without a hitch. My only complaint would be the menu. If you plugged in a hard drive with 100's of files, it would be cumbersome. What I do is load an 8 gig stick and plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Mcnally

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: i have 3 of these and i haven't had any problems out of any of them! you can't move files between drives with this version but i knew that and the remote is a little slow but thats it. just remember to check for updates and thats about it!
customer_reviews.author: bygremlin

customer_reviews.title: Best Alternative to BD Players
customer_reviews.text: This is the best alternative if you want to watch movies in HD and don't want to spend too much on BD Players and Discs. There's plenty of High Def content available for download, plug your USB drive into the WD HD Media Player and you are ready to go. DTS output is available through TOSLINK cable. If you already have a home theater setup with a HDTV and you are missing HD Content, this is the device for you! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Satish Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: This along with an external drive let me free up the much needed space on my desktop. It also is so easy to use with the DVD like controls on the remote. Great idea that should have been around for years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tutor

customer_reviews.title: OK product
customer_reviews.text: I would say overall I am happy with this unit. The only complaint I have is that it seems to be a little slow. The movies that I have watched stutter, that is the best way I can describe it. It is mostly when the camera is panning I think that the WD media player could use a faster processor. For the price I paid I really can't complain as beats the heck out of not being able to watch something in HD.
customer_reviews.author: Robert dluehosh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT... but, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, is great, like the 1080p output (ATV does not have it), functionality is OK; as promised. I do own an AppleTV, and doing a comparison, ATV have tons of features WD lacks of it, like a Fast forward, if a movie is ripped without chapters, and you want to see the end, it's going to take you a lot of time to go to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo RV

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in hopes of being able to get movies from our family's various video cameras to work on my new smart TV because the TV would only read certain file types. I am amazed at what this little box can do. I haven't found a file it hasn't liked yet. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: media player works great
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these media players in my living room. this one was for my bedroom. Makes it to where we can watch netflix on our t.v. Very happy with this player
customer_reviews.author: S. geyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, especially the streaming it allows from my computer. Now I watch everything I have stored on my much larger television without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: This is da bomb!!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply delighted and better than my media PC in number of ways. There is a brand new firmware 4/27 and I was able to play all sort of mkv, avi and iso files.... Awesome ask me anything...
customer_reviews.author: Louis Y.

customer_reviews.title: A great start
customer_reviews.text: We've had this media player for 8 months now. Its simple enough to operate that my 3yr old can operate the remote control. product_meta.title: WD TV HD Media Player
product_meta.description:
The WDTV HD Media Player is full HD 1080p video playback and is an ultra-compact, USB 2.0 device that attaches to an entertainment unit through a variety of audio/video interfaces and supports playback of major audio, video, and image file formats. It supports high-definition video playback of up to 1080p through an HDMI connection or standard definition for TVs with lower capabilities. It includes remote control, composit AV cable, AC adapter and quick install guide. (Brown Box, Product is Recertified)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer Combined with a My Passport portable drive (sold separately), this player is the most convenient way to play HD movies or user-generated videos, listen to high-quality digital music and show high-resolution slideshows of your family photos on your TV. Also works with popular USB drives, and digital cameras, camcorders, and portable media players that can be recognized as mass storage devices.

Features at a glance  * Full HD 1080p 
 * High-def menus 
 * Access two USB drives simultaneously 
 * HDMI and composite video connection (HDMI cable not included)
 * Includes free media conversion software 
 * 1-year limited warranty

Simple and compact. Designed to easily fit on or in your media cabinet. (My Passport™ portable drive sold separately) Browse through your media with beautiful high-definition menus. Designed for My Passport, works with many other USB storage devices - Play content from most popular USB drives, and digital cameras, camcorders, and portable media players that can be recognized as mass storage devices. 

Full HD video playback and navigation - Up to 1080p - Experience the spectacular picture quality of HD video and crystal clear sound clarity of digital audio. Use the included remote control to navigate through your entertainment choices using our crisp, animated HD menus. 

Collect without limits - There's no limit to the size of your media collection; just add more USB drives for more space. 

Advanced navigation

Thumbnail and list views – Browse your content by filename or by thumbnails of photos, album covers and movie cover art.

Media Library – This unique feature lets you view all your media by media type in one menu regardless of its location in folders or drives. You can view your content by categories such as genre, album, artist, date.

Search – Search by genre, title, artist, filename, partial filename and most recently viewed.

Photo viewing

--Create custom slide shows with a variety of transitions and background music
--Zoom and pan


Movie viewing

--Fast forward, rewind, pause, zoom, and pan
--View subtitles


Music playback

--Fast forward, rewind, pause, shuffle, repeat

Access two USB drives simultaneously - Two USB ports on the player let you connect two USB storage devices and access them simultaneously. Our Media Library feature aggregates the content on both drives into one list sorted by media type.

HDMI and composite video connections - The High-Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) port lets you connect to the highest quality HDTV or home theater. Additional composite (RCA) outputs ensure compatibility with virtually all television sets.

Includes free media conversion software - ArcSoft MediaConverter™ 2.5 -- a fast, easy-to-use application that converts photo, video, and music files into formats optimized for use on the WD TV HD Media Player.

File Formats Supported 
Music - MP3, WMA, OGG, WAV/PCM/LPCM, AAC, FLAC, Dolby Digital, AIF/AIFF, MKA 
Graphics - JPEG, GIF, TIF/TIFF, BMP, PNG Video -MPEG1/2/4, WMV9, AVI (MPEG4, Xvid, AVC), H.264, MKV, MOV (MPEG4, H.264)
Playlist - PLS, M3U, WPL Subtitle -SRT (UTF-8)

Note:
- MPEG2/4, H.264, and WMV9 supports up to 1920x1080p 24fps, 1920x1080i 30fps, 1280x720p 60fps resolution.
- An audio receiver is required for surround sound output. 
- AAC/Dolby Digital decodes in 2 channel output only.
- JPEG does not support CMYK or lossless.
- BMP supports uncompressed format only.
- TIF/TIFF supports single layer only.

Formats not supported -- Does not support protected premium content such as movies or music from the iTunes® Store, Cinema Now, Movielink®, Amazon Unbox™, and Vongo®

System Requirements: My Passport portable hard drive or other USB storage device with supported video or audio content stored on it. Standard or high definition television with HDMI or composite video connections.

Package Contents: HD Media Player, compact remote with batteries, CD with Media converter software (Windows only), composite AV cable, AC adapter, Quick Install Guide
